message_1: If $p$ is a prime number and $a$ is an integer that is not divisible by $p$, what is the remainder when $a^{p-1}$ is divided by $p$?
message_2: By Fermat's Little Theorem, if $p$ is a prime number and $a$ is an integer not divisible by $p$, then $a^{p-1} \equiv 1 \pmod{p}$. Therefore, the remainder when $a^{p-1}$ is divided by $p$ is $\boxed{1}$.
